intro: Carduus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf thistle, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters, featuring a hairy stem and dark green, lobed leaves. The plant produces purple to violet flowers with prominent central cones, which are characteristic of the Asteraceae family. Its foliage is often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Carduus nanus is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is considered a hardy plant that can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
